description.narrative: 1) Through this project, IFC will facilitate the consolidation of the Russian banking sector: Orient Express has already merged with four smaller banks in 2009 and 2010, and has both appetite and capacity to continue acquisitions of small and medium banks in the next two - three years. 2) In cooperation with Orient Express Bank, IFC can further contribute to climate change mitigation and development of the energy efficiency market through enhancement of energy efficiency component in retail lending. 3) Through this project, IFC can facilitate further increase of access to finance for SMEs across sectors: Orient Express is currently operating as a primarily retail bank with a small share of micro and SME lending, but has good platform and systems in place to develop micro and small enterprise lending on a much broader scale. 4) Through this project, IFC will strengthen its business partnership with a systemically important bank operating in less-developed regions where significant developmental challenges remain: Orient Express operates in a number of frontier regions of Russia, where access to finance is especially important. Going forward, as Orient Express acquires additional banks, its distribution network will further expand and its ability to reach more clients in frontier regions will increase.

The project consists of a convertible loan to OJSC Orient Express Bank (Orient Express, or the Bank) in the amount of up to $75 million. Orient Express is a large privately-owned regional bank headquartered in Khabarovsk, Far East, and an important strategic partner for IFC in Russia due to its significant regional presence, including 14 frontier regions, experienced management team, and extensive outreach potential, which IFC can help the Bank maximize. As of July 1, 2010 the Bank ranked among top 50 banks in Russia by total assets and among the top 10 banks by branch network size: 464 offices in 179 towns and cities with population ranging between 30 thousand and 10 million people in each location, spread over several Federal Districts of Russia. Although the Bank is currently mostly retail-oriented, in the future it plans to become a more active player in the micro and small enterprise lending segment, too.
